alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 1:31PM MST until August 15 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 127 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across northern Apache. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chinle, Del Muerto, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Nazlini, Sehili, Many Farms Lake, Many Farms, and Tsaile. This includes the following highways... Highway 191 between mile markers 431 and 477. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Muerto, Cottonwood Wash, Black Mountain Wash, Quartzite Canyon, Coyote Wash, Lukachukai Creek, Greasewood Wash, Chinle Wash, Tiis Ndiitsooi Wash, Wheatfields Creek, Agua Sal Creek, Ruin Wash, White Water Wash, Balakai Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Black Rock Canyon, and Lone Tule Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
